org.assertj.swing.fixture

Class JTreeFixture

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.assertj.swing.fixture.AbstractComponentFixture<S,T,D>
      • org.assertj.swing.fixture.AbstractJComponentFixture<S,T,D>
        • org.assertj.swing.fixture.AbstractJPopupMenuInvokerFixture<JTreeFixture,javax.swing.JTree,JTreeDriver>
          • org.assertj.swing.fixture.JTreeFixture
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EditableComponentFixture<JTreeFixture>, JComponentFixture<JTreeFixture>, JPopupMenuInvokerFixture, MouseInputSimulationFixture<JTreeFixture>

    public class JTreeFixture
extends AbstractJPopupMenuInvokerFixture<JTreeFixture,javax.swing.JTree,JTreeDriver>
implements EditableComponentFixture<JTreeFixture>

    Supports functional testing of JTrees.

    TreePaths can be specified using Strings. For example, for the following tree: 

     root
   |
   -- node1
      |
      -- node1.1

    we can identify the node "node1.1" as follows: 

       root/node1/node1.1

    The default path separator is "/". It can be changed by calling replaceSeparator(String).

    The conversion between the values given in tests and the values being displayed by a JTree renderer is performed by a JTreeCellReader. This fixture uses a BasicJTreeCellReader by default.

    Author:
    Keith Coughtrey, Alex Ruiz, Yvonne Wang, Fabien Barbero

public JTreeFixture clickRow(int row)
        Clicks the given row.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        this fixture.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the JTree is disabled.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the JTree is not showing on the screen.
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the given row is less than zero or equal than or greater than the number of visible rows in the JTree.
        LocationUnavailableException - if a tree path for the given row cannot be found.

      • showPopupMenuAt

        @Nonnull
public JPopupMenuFixture showPopupMenuAt(@Nonnull
                                        java.lang.String path)
        Shows a pop-up menu at the position of the last node in the given path. The last node in the given path will be made visible (by expanding the parent node(s)) if it is not visible.
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the node invoking the pop-up menu.
        Returns:
        a fixture that manages the displayed pop-up menu.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this fixture's JTree is disabled.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this fixture's JTree is not showing on the screen.
        ComponentLookupException - if a pop-up menu cannot be found.
        LocationUnavailableException - if the given path cannot be found.

      • node

        @Nonnull
public JTreePathFixture node(@Nonnull
                            java.lang.String path)
        Returns a fixture that manages the node specified by the given path.
        Parameters:
        path - the given path.
        Returns:
        a fixture that manages the node specified by the given path.
        Throws:
        LocationUnavailableException - if the given path cannot be found.

      • valueAt

        @Nullable
public java.lang.String valueAt(int row)
        Returns the String representation of the given row.
        Parameters:
        row - the given row.
        Returns:
        the String representation of the node at the given path.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the given row is less than zero or equal than or greater than the number of visible rows in the JTree.
        LocationUnavailableException - if a tree path for the given row cannot be found.

        path - the given path.
        Returns:
        the String representation of the node at the given path.
